questions.question: What is the purpose of a 2:1 multiplexer?

answers.a: To select one of two inputs based on a control signal.
answers.b: To combine two inputs into a single output.
answers.c: To perform logical AND operation on two inputs.
answers.d: To perform logical OR operation on two inputs.

explanations.a: A 2:1 multiplexer selects one of two inputs based on a control signal, making it a versatile digital circuit component.
explanations.b: Incorrect. The purpose of a 2:1 multiplexer is to select between two inputs, not combine them.
explanations.c: Incorrect. A 2:1 multiplexer is not designed for logical AND operation.
explanations.d: Incorrect. A 2:1 multiplexer is not designed for logical OR operation.
